intro: Paraboea nanxiensis, commonly known as the Chinese paraboea, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare species with limited ecological significance.
